name: Blockbuilders Design Concept
description: High-level design concept and creative direction for the Blockbuilders visual strategy builder application

brandIdentity.name: Blockbuilders
brandIdentity.tagline: Visual Strategy Lab for Crypto Traders
brandIdentity.targetAudience: Non-technical retail crypto traders who want to build and backtest strategies visually

corePrinciples.name: Clarity Over Complexity
corePrinciples.description: Every element should communicate its purpose immediately. Trading is complex enough; the interface should simplify, not add confusion.

corePrinciples.name: Visual Hierarchy Through Color
corePrinciples.description: Use color purposefully to categorize, distinguish, and guide. The canvas node system uses semantic color-coding to help users understand block types at a glance.

corePrinciples.name: Functional Minimalism
corePrinciples.description: Include only what's necessary. White space is valued. Every component earns its place by serving a clear function.

corePrinciples.name: Progressive Disclosure
corePrinciples.description: Show essential information first; reveal complexity only when needed. Tooltips, expandable sections, and contextual help support without overwhelming.

corePrinciples.name: Consistent Patterns
corePrinciples.description: Reuse established patterns across the application. Familiarity reduces cognitive load and speeds up user workflows.

designPhilosophy.designMood: Premium fintech with an approachable, modern edge. Think: Linear, Vercel, or high-end trading dashboards — sophisticated yet welcoming to beginners.

visualIdentity.description: Subtle depth and refined polish distinguish the UI from generic templates
techniques: Layered backgrounds with faint radial gradients (not flat white/black)
Gradient text headings for brand moments (purple-to-indigo via .text-gradient-primary)
Frosted glass effects (backdrop-blur + semi-transparent backgrounds) for elevated surfaces
Refined card hover states with smooth shadow transitions (duration-200)
Gradient borders on persistent chrome (header bottom border fades via-border)
Tighter letter-spacing (tracking-tight) on headings for premium typography feel
Tabular-nums on all numeric data for proper alignment in tables and metrics

colorStrategy.philosophy: Purple as the primary brand color conveys creativity and innovation. The palette balances professionalism with approachability through careful use of neutrals and semantic colors.

primary.description: Vibrant purple - represents creativity, innovation, and the building blocks concept
primary.usage: Primary actions, brand elements, active states, focus rings

categories.description: Five distinct colors for canvas block categories, enabling instant visual recognition

risk.meaning: Risk management - stop-loss, take-profit, position sizing

feedback.error: Red - errors, validation failures, destructive actions

neutrals.philosophy: Clean grays with slight cool undertones create a professional backdrop that doesn't compete with semantic colors. Subtle radial gradients add depth without distraction.

background.lightMode: Pure white (#FFFFFF) with faint purple radial gradient at top (primary/0.04)
background.darkMode: Deep navy-gray (HSL 224, 71.4%, 4.1%) with stronger purple radial gradient at top (primary/0.08)
background.gradientPattern: Two overlapping ellipses — primary-tinted at top center, blue-tinted at right — creating subtle ambient color

surfaces.lightMode: Off-white to light gray for elevated surfaces
surfaces.darkMode: Slightly lighter navy-gray for elevated surfaces
surfaces.frostedGlass: backdrop-blur-xl + semi-transparent background (bg-background/80) for floating panels and auth forms

text.primary: Near-black in light mode, near-white in dark mode
text.muted: Light gray for hints and disabled states

darkModeStrategy.approach: True dark mode with inverted luminance, maintaining color relationships and semantic meaning. Dark mode should feel equally premium — not an afterthought.
principles: Background becomes dark, text becomes light
Accent colors slightly adjust saturation/lightness for proper contrast
Category colors maintain their hue but adapt brightness for dark backgrounds
Shadows become more subtle, borders more prominent
Background gradients use stronger opacity in dark mode (0.08 vs 0.04) for visible depth
Feedback badges use dark: variants (e.g., dark:bg-purple-950 dark:text-purple-300)

typographyStrategy.philosophy: System fonts for performance and familiarity. Clear hierarchy through size and weight, with selective gradient text for brand moments.

fontFamily.primary: System UI font stack (San Francisco, Segoe UI, Roboto)
fontFamily.monospace: System monospace for code and numeric values

small.usage: Badges, timestamps, canvas node labels, help text

gradientText.implementation: bg-clip-text text-transparent with linear-gradient(135deg, primary, blue-indigo)
gradientText.usage: Hero headings, welcome greetings, brand moments — use sparingly for impact

principles: Limit to 2-3 font weights per view to maintain visual calm
Use size + weight together for hierarchy, not color alone
Use tracking-tight on headings for a premium, refined feel
Use tabular-nums (font-variant-numeric) for all numeric data in tables and metrics

spacingStrategy.philosophy: Consistent spacing creates rhythm and reduces visual chaos. Use a base-4 scale for predictable, harmonious layouts.

scale.description: 4px base unit, scaling by factors of 2

layoutStrategy.philosophy: Mobile-first responsive design. Layouts gracefully adapt from single-column mobile to multi-column desktop.

containerWidth.usage: Main content area, centered with auto margins

patterns.stack: Vertical stacking for mobile, primary layout pattern
patterns.grid: 2-3 column grids on desktop for related items
patterns.sidebar: Collapsible sidebar on mobile (off-canvas), fixed on desktop
patterns.splitLayout: Side-by-side panels on desktop (brand + form), stacked on mobile — used for auth page
patterns.heroSection: Full-width heading area without card wrapper, using gradient text and subtle description
patterns.statCards: Compact icon + metric + label cards in a horizontal row for key numbers
patterns.stickyBar: Sticky positioned bar with backdrop-blur for contextual bulk actions

mobileConsiderations: Larger padding and font sizes for touch interaction
Canvas nodes scale up handles and padding in mobile mode

borders.color: Light gray in light mode, dark gray in dark mode

shadows.philosophy: Subtle shadows for elevation. Never heavy or dramatic.

states.hover: Subtle background change with smooth shadow transition (hover:shadow-md, duration-200), never jarring
states.focus: 1px ring in primary color, clear but not overwhelming
states.groupHover: Cards and list items use group/group-hover for coordinated child element transitions (e.g., name color changes on card hover)

animations.philosophy: Purposeful, brief animations that provide feedback without slowing users down
animations.easing: ease-out for entrances, ease-in for exits
types: Scale - slight zoom for modals and popovers
Slide - directional movement for sheets and drawers

iconography.philosophy: Simple, consistent line icons that complement rather than dominate. Icons are used alongside section titles, in stat cards, and in empty states for visual anchoring.

sizing.small: 14px (h-3.5 w-3.5) - inline with buttons and small text
sizing.medium: 20px (size-5, h-5 w-5) - stat card icons, navigation
sizing.large: 28-32px (h-7 w-7) - empty state illustrations, hero elements

iconography.style: Stroke-based, 2px stroke width, rounded line caps

patterns.sectionHeaders: Small muted icon (h-4 w-4 text-muted-foreground) paired with section title text
patterns.statCards: Icon in colored rounded-lg container (h-10 w-10 bg-{color}/10 text-{color})
patterns.emptyStates: Large icon in rounded-full container (h-14 w-14 bg-primary/10) above text
patterns.buttonIcons: Small icon (h-4 w-4) with mr-2 spacing before button label

strategyCanvas.description: The visual node-based strategy builder is a core differentiator and has its own design subsystem
principles: Nodes are color-coded by category for instant recognition
Connections use smooth curves, colored to match source node
Selected state uses stronger border color
Error state adds red border with glow ring
Mobile mode increases touch targets and padding

nodeAnatomy.header: Colored background, small text, icon for info

dataVisualization.description: Charts and graphs for backtest results

accessibilityCommitments: Visible focus indicators on all interactive elements
Color is never the only means of conveying information
Screen reader friendly with proper ARIA labels

whenInDoubt: Match existing patterns before inventing new ones
Ask: does this serve the user's task?
antiPatterns: Decorative elements that don't serve a purpose
Color used for emphasis without semantic meaning
Animations longer than 300ms for UI feedback
New patterns when existing ones would work
